column4: Better not switch from your iPhone!
column6: Two months back, I switched from my iPhone 6 to Pixel 3. There are lots of pros and cons to this phone, so let me summarise my experience.Pros:1) Excellent camera that I'm quite impressed with. It provides high quality shots even in poor light. Gives an SLR like feel to the images.2) The stock Android functions like keyboard swipe were missed in the iPhone.Cons:1) Pathetic, tinny sound. Sometimes it feels like I'm listening to a pocket transistor. The sound is no match even for an iPhone 6. I'm genuinely surprised at how bad the sound quality is. Also, I have to constantly adjust volume settings between apps and calls because the rise and fall in volume levels is sharp.2) Not impressed with the battery. As soon as you pick up the 100% charged phone in the morning, you'll notice a dramatic drop-off in battery just after a few minutes of social media and WhatsApp use. By noon, the battery will be down to the 50-60% range despite only moderate use. I haven't yet travelled with this phone, but I'll have to strongly consider travelling with a power bank.3) The charger cable provided in the box has no USB A type, you'll need to buy a spare cable immediately. Also, there's no headphone jack, so good luck managing your cables and headphones.  There's one adapter jack provided in the box, but it's quite possible you may need several of these between work and home. The headphones provided in the box are quite good.4) The C type cable has a poor build. Refer to the image attached. I treat my cables gently and they normally last years. But the Pixel 3 cable after less than 2 months of moderate use is ready to snap at the joint. Despite being in warranty, Google is refusing to replace it. This was the most disappointing aspect of this purchase.5) This is a brand new phone, but it heats up pretty quickly to uncomfortably hot levels especially while I'm multitasking.Overall, if you've been using an iPhone (6 or above), Pixel 3 may feel like a step-down in some ways. There are plenty of apps that work much better on iPhone but are clunky on Android. Also, you could argue that the Apple UX is much better. My advice: pay a few thousand rupees more and stick to Apple.If you're moving up from an Android, the Pixel may appear to be an attractive choice in comparison to whatever you'd been using earlier.

I am a Samsung enthusiast. I love Samsung. But there is something Samsung did that I don't like. I don't like their cameras. I find that the deteoriation that the camera suffers is substantial. Also I have to keep wiping the camera lens. I have heard a lot about the Pixel 3A camera so I decided to jump ship. Today about 3 weeks have passed since I began using the Pixel 3A XL.PROS -1) You know all the pundits who said Stock Android is the best? Trust me when I say this - you have not used Stock Android until you have used the PIXEL 3a XL.  The applications are smooth, the colours and wallpapers seamless, the phone is very fast. Compared to my S9 plus the applications load way faster. The keyboard is a lot better.2) The camera is the best I have used. My iPhone 8 looks trashy in comparison and that is a big comparison. It has an amazing feel to it. Food pics are top. Building photos look amazing. The night vision is as good as they say it is. The selfie camera is ok. But the detail you will get from a Pixel 3A camera rivals that of an IPhone XS. I am not saying I like it more than the camera of an iPhone XS Max. But yes, its definitely the second best camera. The shutter is snappy. Press the power button twice and you are good to go as the camera uploads. Its snappy. I can't find a flaw with the camera except portrait images are very cropped. That's a bit of a low blow. You can choose the frames per second of time lapse. There are a dozen other shooting modes. If you are into instagram or whatsapp or facebook, you are going to need no other phone again. The videos are decent. Not as good as still photos.3) Good Connection + Call Quality4) Decent Speaker - Not louder than S9 Plus. Even on bluetooth audio output I think nothing is louder than the Samsung. But the clarity and bass level tuning is perfection.  You can listen to podscasts and youtube interviews for hours.5) Headphone Jack - used once but its there guys! Amazing. Its located on top left.6) Its just 167 grams. Feels so much lighter than the S9 plus. I carry two phones so who wants to have a heavy phone. This is light. I also have a case on it and it still feels light. It does not feel cheapy without the case. The case I have used is Spigen Tough Armor for about 900.  So even with the case its very light. I can use without case also.7) On Screen Display - This is a 100% better on screen display than Samsung. the implementation is unique.8) Battery life - I have never used a phone which lasts me all day. This is the first of its kind. I never use power saving mode. At 100% it lasts me 6 hours on screen display including navigation and all. That's incredible. This is one reason I love this phone.Overall love the phone but there are certain demerits which may make it bad for you. Those are1) The display in the sun is 6/10 and thats the biggest flaw. It is not 80% as good as the S9 Plus.2) No Notification LED3) Google Assistant is a fool. Siri is the best.4) Takes 120 minutes to charge to 100.5) Wish It was louder as speaker6) No water proof7) Selfie Camera is not polished8) Display is good. But not great. Resolution is apt though.Overall? Just buy it. Trust me. Use it for 10 days and you will love it.Check the images attached and please click helpful so more people read a genuine review of this phone.

column6: I was previously using Lenovo Z2 plus and it was one of the best phones in 2017 offering snapdragon 820 at just RS. 10,000. I had to cancel all installs and download it at my office Wifi. 2)The next thing is that, the phone is really really HEAVY. I was using it with my left hand while I was sleeping, and literally after 5 minutes my wrist started to pain. But what if it falls on my head or mouth, like all the phones do? Don't talk about the front camera, I use my sister's Realme 1 for taking selfies...4) PUBG: So when I open the game, it has loading error, says 'Could not connect to server' seems to be network issue, but the Realme 1 loads properly without any issues, even when both the phones are in the SAME room. Also the map in Realme 1 loads faster, maybe because it has 6 GB ram and the one I am using has 4 GB. I should have gone for Realme 2 pro which had 6 Gb for lesser Price.I wished I had ordered Realme 2 pro. Too lazy to return then get refund and all. But if you need a light phone, go for Realme 2 pro. it's light, games don't lag and also has a good battery. I'm just somewhat sad. column6: Guys, I am in a confusion for about 3 weeks on which phone to buy in the sale season. Poco F1, Honor play, Zenfone 5z and OnePlus 6. These are my shortlists and I first removed op6 because I personally didn't like oneplus because of its overrated specs and camera. SD845 is capable of AI but there is no single feature (thati know of) that used AI in oxygen OS. Then I started reading the official forums of these 3 phones. In Zenfone 5z forums, there are so many people complaining of its bugs and slow updates fixing those bugs. So I removed it next. Then I started thinking extensively on what to buy in between poco F1 and Honor play.I started reading Honor play forums first. In all reviews there, I see people are very satisfied with this and there are very very few complaints in the forumsR (may be a in 20). But I am inclined towards towards sd845 of poco. So, I started reading it's forums and there, I have observed so many people complaining of its build quality and display. I am still convinced some how to compromise on these two. And thought of buying it only because of sd845. I kept on reading the forums day to day. And the complaints in the poco forums kept on increasing related to its display. I have seen one complaint related to screen bleeding in poco for which the company said it is a software issue. I didn't understand how far it is true. What I wanted is not give discouraged after investing 20K of my money. So finally I took the call and ordered HONOR PLAY. I believed in the public forums but not YouTube reviews. The forums will never give wrong data as far as I believe.5 star for the delivery. I got the order delivered on the very next day. Thanks to Amazon. Now coming to mobile,Believe me guys, this is a beast. U will never feel bad for investing ur hard earned 18k on this phone.1) the build quality is excellent. It feels very premium in hand.2) camera is awesome. The pics that I take from this phone really comes very very gud. U can follow me at @praveen_buddhavarapu in Instagram to see some samples of this camera. U won't believe me if I say the night mode is also very Gud. The entire YouTube has completely gone angry with the nightmode of this phone. But believe me guys this phone's camera is no where less to any flagship camera even in night mode.3) the gallery app. This is the most lovely thing in this phone. I have been wondering how apple used face recognition and sorts photos based on faces, places and things. The same is also being done by Honor in this phone. The gallery app sorts and orders the pics based on the location, faces, things. And the next best thing is, it creates videos of the people like how apple does in iOS gallery app.4) Histen audio feature. If u wear earphones and listen to some FLAC songs with full volume with the Histen sound mode set to auto, trust me u will feel very much involved in the song and u can definitely forget about the sorroundings (use it at high volume only in ur personal place, but please keep track of us sorroundings in public places)4) Display is awesome. I have used a mobile with amoled display previously and I use to feel very indulged when I watch HD videos in it. The fhd display in Honor play is no where inferior to the amoled display and u can find no difference at all in between the two displays.5) the massive 3750 mah battery is a great thing in this phone. I don't use dual sim though my previous phones have dual sim support. I always use only one Airtel sim. With single sim, the battery use to stand for 1 and half day completely with normal usage. Always internet was on and screen on time is around 2-3hrs in an average.6) EMUI is perfectly blended. No bugs umi identified in my personal usage except one personal suggestion. That is they have to implement the iPhone X kind of gestures as soon as possible in this. Because when we type something, the on screen home button comes exactly down the space button and in speed typing, I sometimes use to hit on the home button instead of space. So this is the only problem is faced in this. Though Honor has confirmed the iPhone X style of gestures in Pie update, I am eagerly waiting for it.7) the notification led is placed at the correct position inside the earpiece. I think all the phones should place the led inside the earpiece as it won't take any extra place there. I tested it with blue, white, orange, green  olkurs. But I think it will glow in some other colours as well.8) lastly the performance, man this is a beast. I can't say anything more. I have been using this for past one month and I never faced single hiccup with this phone. like the phone was branded, it is very smooth a gaming. I play pubg atleast 3-4 full games per day (mean 1-2 hrs daily) and I never faced any issue like lag or frame drop with this phone. The gaming suite is awesome. It won't show the annoying notifications as notification heads when we are playing any games.Finally I can say that this is a phone worth its price and worth my time I spent looking at reviews for this. I first feared that, after buying this phone, i might get a feeling that I didn't buy poco or Zenfone. But I never got such a feelong while using this. I am very much satisfied with this mobile and i'm happy that I didn't buy POCO. I don't know how many issues that I would face if I had bought poco.Hope this review helps u to decide on ur phone. Please let me know if u have any questions related to this phone. I am happy to answer.

U can follow me at @praveen_buddhavarapu in Instagram to see some samples of this camera. U won't believe me if I say the night mode is also very Gud. The entire YouTube has completely gone angry with the nightmode of this phone. But believe me guys this phone's camera is no where less to any flagship camera even in night mode.3) the gallery app. This is the most lovely thing in this phone. I have been wondering how apple used face recognition and sorts photos based on faces, places and things. The same is also being done by Honor in this phone. The gallery app sorts and orders the pics based on the location, faces, things. And the next best thing is, it creates videos of the people like how apple does in iOS gallery app.4) Histen audio feature. If u wear earphones and listen to some FLAC songs with full volume with the Histen sound mode set to auto, trust me u will feel very much involved in the song and u can definitely forget about the sorroundings (use it at high volume only in ur personal place, but please keep track of us sorroundings in public places)4) Display is awesome. I have used a mobile with amoled display previously and I use to feel very indulged when I watch HD videos in it. The fhd display in Honor play is no where inferior to the amoled display and u can find no difference at all in between the two displays.5) the massive 3750 mah battery is a great thing in this phone. I don't use dual sim though my previous phones have dual sim support. I always use only one Airtel sim. With single sim, the battery use to stand for 1 and half day completely with normal usage. Always internet was on and screen on time is around 2-3hrs in an average.6) EMUI is perfectly blended. No bugs umi identified in my personal usage except one personal suggestion. That is they have to implement the iPhone X kind of gestures as soon as possible in this. Because when we type something, the on screen home button comes exactly down the space button and in speed typing, I sometimes use to hit on the home button instead of space. So this is the only problem is faced in this. Though Honor has confirmed the iPhone X style of gestures in Pie update, I am eagerly waiting for it.7) the notification led is placed at the correct position inside the earpiece. I think all the phones should place the led inside the earpiece as it won't take any extra place there. I tested it with blue, white, orange, green  olkurs. But I think it will glow in some other colours as well.8) lastly the performance, man this is a beast. I can't say anything more. I have been using this for past one month and I never faced single hiccup with this phone. like the phone was branded, it is very smooth a gaming. I play pubg atleast 3-4 full games per day (mean 1-2 hrs daily) and I never faced any issue like lag or frame drop with this phone. The gaming suite is awesome. It won't show the annoying notifications as notification heads when we are playing any games.Finally I can say that this is a phone worth its price and worth my time I spent looking at reviews for this. I first feared that, after buying this phone, i might get a feeling that I didn't buy poco or Zenfone. But I never got such a feelong while using this. I am very much satisfied with this mobile and i'm happy that I didn't buy POCO. I don't know how many issues that I would face if I had bought poco.Hope this review helps u to decide on ur phone. Please let me know if u have any questions related to this phone. I am happy to answer.

Also the map in Realme 1 loads faster, maybe because it has 6 GB ram and the one I am using has 4 GB. I had to cancel all installs and download it at my office Wifi. 2)The next thing is that, the phone is really really HEAVY. I was using it with my left hand while I was sleeping, and literally after 5 minutes my wrist started to pain. But what if it falls on my head or mouth, like all the phones do? While using it lying on the bed? I am going to get a serious injury. In the Tech pages too, they have mentioned this as a Con.3)Front Camera:  The Camera really SUCKs. Don't talk about the front camera, I use my sister's Realme 1 for taking selfies...4) PUBG: So when I open the game, it has loading error, says 'Could not connect to server' seems to be network issue, but the Realme 1 loads properly without any issues, even when both the phones are in the SAME room. Also the map in Realme 1 loads faster, maybe because it has 6 GB ram and the one I am using has 4 GB. I should have gone for Realme 2 pro which had 6 Gb for lesser Price.I wished I had ordered Realme 2 pro. Too lazy to return then get refund and all. But if you need a light phone, go for Realme 2 pro. it's light, games don't lag and also has a good battery. I'm just somewhat sad.  And the Customer Service of HONOR is so pathetic, they don't know what I am asking and COPY PASTE wrong info in the chat, I once had to talk with a Supervisor to get the correct information.
